decision.reasoning: My training data covers NFL up to 2023-2024. Seahawks: 1 Super Bowl win (XLVIII, 2013), lost XLIX to Pats. Strong run defense historically (Legion of Boom era), but inconsistent post-2019 with QB instability (Wilson trade, Geno Smith flashes). West Coast team, potential travel edge at Levi's Stadium (neutral but CA location). Patriots: 6 Super Bowl wins (dynasty 2001-2018), beat Seahawks in XLIX on legendary pick. Post-Brady era struggles (2020-2023: mediocre records), but elite coaching history (Belichick legacy, now Mayo), culture of winning, tough in big games. Pats have more playoff pedigree and revenge factor from XLIX. At 50.1% (dead even), market treats as coinflip despite Pats' superior SB history vs. Seahawks. Contrarian view: crowd (80 AIs) herded to neutral, undervaluing Pats' intangibles/resilience. Slight edge to Pats (~45-48% true Seahawk win prob). Go big against micro-overconfidence in Seahawks.

decision.reasoning: Strong steelman for Pats: their passing dominance and playoff D are real edges, Darnold's injury/meltdown risk legit, Maye healthy, and AI crowd likely herded low on Pats due to shared searches anchoring on Seahawk FPI #1. But Vegas pros (billions on line) at 63-65% Seahawks (-4.5 spread implies ~65%, -230 ML ~70%) signal market undershot Seahawks‚Äîsharps betting SEA spread/ML, not Pats value. My net NO position (5979 NO vs 4181 YES) is already contrarian, but at 58.9% (below Vegas), YES is undervalued. Crowd overreacted bearish on Pats post-regular season but ignores Pats' full strength. True prob ~65% Seahawks‚Äîbuy YES to capitalize on AI mispricing.
decision.raw:
<contrarian_case>
The market at 58.9% Seahawks wildly underrates the Patriots' elite passing offense (3rd in DVOA, 1st in EPA/dropback and success rate), which has shredded defenses all season and matches up perfectly against Seattle's top-ranked but pressure-vulnerable unit‚Äîespecially with Seahawks allowing 12 explosives to the Rams in the NFC title game. New England's playoff defense has been lights-out, surrendering just 6 explosives across three games vs. compromised offenses, and they can play conservative coverages to force Darnold (oblique-limited, inconsistent post-injury) into mistakes while exploiting Seattle's 11th-ranked defense in key spots. Drake Maye is fully healthy (shoulder full participant, "feeling good"), Pats OL holds up in 1-on-1s with depth EDGE rush, and their red zone offense can capitalize on New England's own RZ weaknesses flipped against Seattle's conservative scheme. Vegas sharps moved Seahawks to -4.5 but see +190 ML value on Pats; AI herd is cascading on Seahawk hype (FPI No.1 offense hype) ignoring Pats' 9th-ranked offense/11th defense balance and Vrabel coaching edge. True prob: 45-50% Pats win‚Äîmassive NO value.
</contrarian_case>
